questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Master-Detail relationships? (Choose three.)

choices.B: Converting a look-up to master detail changes the OWD to Controlled by Parent.
choices.D: SF displays a waiting page after you request to change a master detail to a look-up or vice versa.
choices.A: You can't convert it if there is a roll-up summary field.
choices.C: A look-up can be converted to a master detail if there are existing records with null values.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
A, B and D are correct.

Selected Answer: ABD
A, B and D are correct.
A B and D - You can convert a lookup relationship to a master-detail relationship, but only if the lookup field in all records contains a value.

If your organization has a large number of records, Salesforce displays a waiting page after you have requested to change a master-detail into a lookup relationship or a lookup into a master-detail relationship

questions.question_text: What happens when you convert a picklist to a multi-select picklist? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
AB - Currently defined picklist values are retained when you change a picklist to a multi-select picklist. If records contain values that aren’t in the picklist definition, those values are deleted from those records when the data type changes.

Notes on Changing Custom Field Types
Consider the following before converting fields:

Only convert custom fields for which no data exists or you risk losing your data. Changing the data type of an existing custom field can cause data loss in the following situations:
Changing to or from type Date or Date/Time
Changing to Number from any other type
Changing to Percent from any other type
Changing to Currency from any other type
Changing from Checkbox to any other type
Changing from Picklist (Multi-Select) to any other type
Changing to Picklist (Multi-Select) from any other type
Currently defined picklist values are retained when you change a picklist to a multi-select picklist. If records contain values that are not in the picklist definition, those values are deleted from those records when the data type changes.

Changing from Auto Number to any other type
Changing to Auto Number from any type except Text
Changing from Text to Picklist
Changing from Text Area (Long) to any type except Email, Phone, Text, Text Area, or URL
